message_history.content:
Answer the given question. You must conduct reasoning inside <think> and </think> first every time you get new information. After reasoning, if you find you lack some knowledge, you can call a search engine by <search> query </search> and it will return the top searched results between <information> and </information>. You can search as many times as your want. If you find no further external knowledge needed, you can directly provide the answer inside <answer> and </answer>, without detailed illustrations. For example, <answer> Beijing </answer>. Question: Could you please give me a demographic brief analyzing the shifting racial composition of new U.S. citizens since 2002? This requires a year-by-year breakdown of their original birthplace composition from 2002 to 2022. Using U.S. Department of Homeland Security Yearbook of Immigration Statistics, the Annual Flow Reports, and archived USCIS Factsheets, compile the following metrics for each fiscal year from 2002 through 2022 (including 2022). If a statistic is unavailable, enter NA.

Please output the results in one Markdown table with columns, in this exact order:
Year | Total Naturalized | Born in Africa | Born in Asia | Born in Europe | Born in Caribbean | Born in Central America| Born in other North America | Born in Oceania | Born in South America
Don't ask me any questions, just output the results according to the column without omitting cells arbitrarily. The output format is ```markdown
{data_content}
```?

<think>
To construct this table, I need to gather data on naturalized citizens by birthplace from the U.S. Department of Homeland Security Yearbook of Immigration Statistics, Annual Flow Reports, and archived USCIS Factsheets for each fiscal year from 2002 to 2022. Since this is an extensive task and manual gathering would be time-consuming, I'll use a search approach.
</think>

<search>U.S. Department of Homeland Security Yearbook of Immigration Statistics annual flow reports</search>

Search query: U.S. Department of Homeland Security Yearbook of Immigration Statistics annual flow reports
Result: [Doc 1](https://ohss.dhs.gov/topics/immigration/yearbook):
Yearbook of Immigration Statistics | OHSS Enforcement Actions Annual Flow Report. We release data tables as they become available. We release the final yearbook PDF in September of the ...

[Doc 2](https://ohss.dhs.gov/topics/immigration/yearbook/2024):
Yearbook 2024 | OHSS - Office of Homeland Security Statistics The 2024 Yearbook of Immigration Statistics is a collection of tables about lawful immigration (green cards, etc.)

[Doc 3](https://ohss.dhs.gov/topics/immigration/yearbook/2022):
Yearbook 2022 | OHSS - Office of Homeland Security Statistics The 2022 Yearbook of Immigration Statistics is a collection of tables about immigration for the fiscal year.

Based on these documents, the DHS Yearbook has been released for previous years and likely contains the necessary data. However, I need specific links or direct access to these databases to extract the required statistics. Let's try another search:

[PDF] us citizenship after birth for children of us citizens residing ... - USCIS Must be unmarried and have lawful permanent resident (LPR) status; and. • Must reside in the United States in the legal and physical custody of the U.S. citizen ...

[PDF] U.S. Citizenship at Birth for Children of U.S. Citizen(s) Born Outside ... This fact sheet addresses questions about U.S. citizenship at birth for children who were born outside the. United States to U.S. citizen parents. I Am a U.S. ...

Chapter 3 - U.S. Citizens at Birth (INA 301 and 309) - USCIS A person born outside the United States who acquires U.S. citizenship at birth is not required to have evidence of such status. However, if the person seeks ...

The provided links do not seem to contain the specific yearly breakdowns we need. Thus, I should focus on the DHS Yearbook for factual and yearly statistical access:

Yearbook of Immigration Statistics | OHSS The Yearbook of Immigration Statistics is a collection of tables about ... An official website of the U.S. Department of Homeland Security.
